# rtx_snmp_server (Resource)

Manages SNMP configuration on RTX routers. This is a singleton resource - there is only one SNMP configuration per router.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `chassis_id` (String) System name (SNMP sysName). Unique identifier for the device.
- `community` (Block List) SNMP community configuration (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--community))
- `contact` (String) System contact (SNMP sysContact). Contact information for the device administrator.
- `enable_traps` (List of String) List of trap types to enable. Valid values: all, authentication, coldstart, warmstart, linkdown, linkup, enterprise
- `host` (Block List) SNMP trap host configuration (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--host))
- `location` (String) System location (SNMP sysLocation). Describes the physical location of the device.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedblock--community"></a>
### Nested Schema for `community`

Required:

- `name` (String, Sensitive) Community string name. This is sensitive as it acts as a password for SNMP access.
- `permission` (String) Access permission: 'ro' (read-only) or 'rw' (read-write)

Optional:

- `acl` (String) Access control list number to restrict which hosts can use this community


<a id="nestedblock--host"></a>
### Nested Schema for `host`

Required:

- `ip_address` (String) IP address of the SNMP trap receiver

Optional:

- `community` (String, Sensitive) Community string to use when sending traps to this host
- `version` (String) SNMP version to use: '1' or '2c'
